chunks.original_text: 道士书符诵经，为其忏悔受戒，吐出百余小鱼，平复如旧。 又有男子唯啖臭秽，日五六斗，二十三年，人不喜见。 道士谓曰：汝先身於玄坛中淫欲及大小便，厕溷不浄臭秽，今得此报。 急宜忏悔受戒，勤修无退。 於是男子即诣道士，至心忏悔，受持斋戒。 道士以符投水中，男子服了，便吐蜣螂一千余枚，平复如故。 又有男子日恶草一把，已来腹中恒痛。 八年之中，道士谓曰：汝前生啖食众生，今得此报。 但自首悔。 男子即便首过，誓身为仆贱，供养道士，不辞辛苦。 道士便为诵经受戒，七日夜中，符水咒喷，便化成牛。 一百日中，令知宿命，道士以炼形神符火中化之，反其旧形。 从此受与真经，令终身奉行。 如此之比，说不可计。 吾以道炁散化无方，遍及五亿诸天无极世界，分灵布化，置立职司，主领男女生死簿籍，善恶分明。 诸天之中，各有天帝、四极天师、十华真人、察命童子、善恶主司，记录罪福，微细悉知。 犹如国王统摄天下，人民男女、山川草木，莫不照知，我亦如是。 普济问曰：天尊向说，若国主有灾，兵革四兴，星宿错度，风雨不调，百谷不成，兆民疫疾，国土不安，造立宫观，诞育子孙，兴师动众，有所施为，种种灾厄，一切不详，皆当告我，造大功德。 抄经造像，置观度人，珍宝玩弄、杂彩赀贝、金银珠玉、田园屋宅、宫殿苑囿以用布施，入三宝福田。 度脱众生，救拔危苦，赦放囚徒，建诸斋戒，敷百高座，演诸大乘甚深妙义，劝诱国人，皆令听法，布施忏悔，救护功德，不可思议。 然众生劣弱，气力不同，纵使修行，必不能辩； 能行一事，复虑灾厄不消，进退疑惑，莫能明了。 未审救护功德，有等差否？ 道君答普济曰：救护解厄，本在至诚； 布施舍财，质其心疑。 既众生见有深浅，亦福力致，则有轻重。 今粗言之，凡有五种。 第一者，造我真像，随应化身，福流历劫，胜报无穷。 何以故？ 众生妄想，心不可系，观我真像，便生念想； 想念既生，真灵降接，专诚注仰，克果无为。 救护之中，故为第一。 第二者，抄写经教、三洞大乘，福流永劫，功德无边。 何以故？ 经者，是吾遗教，导引愚迷，能发众生无量道意； 从愚起悟，因悟成真，众圣修行，必登道果。 救护之中，故为弟二。 第三者，置观度人，立堂造殿，福流历劫，不可思议。 何以故？ 一人出家，主持经像，教化众生，令发道意； 一以悟万，轮转因缘，助国化人，弘道明法，利益最多。 救护之中，故为第三。 第四者，修斋行道，礼忏诵经，赞叹烧香，福田无量。 何以故？ 斋以洗心，道能通感，行之谢罪，契以祈恩，功感诸天，消灾降福，生死受赖，斋戒为先。 救护之中，故为第四。 第五者，布施一切，无量福田，果报巍巍，诚为深厚。 何以故？ 财者，众生性命，切己难忘。 能舍命财，心无吝惜，广建功德，普济众生，内息悭贪，外除劫贼，人天利润，生死蒙恩。 救护之中，故为第五。 勤而行之，获福无量。 大上洞玄灵宝业报因缘经卷之六竟 太上洞玄灵宝业报因缘经卷之七 功德品第十六 大慈大悲普济真人，以业报因缘请问太上。 尔时，太上道君告普济曰：吾昔於赤明劫初，在南丹洞浮开阳上观火炼池边，与元始天尊大会说法，广度诸天。
chunks.translated_text:
The Daoist priest inscribed talismans and recited scriptures, leading the man in repentance and receiving the precepts. The man vomited over a hundred small fish, and his condition returned to normal.

Another man consumed only filth, five or six *dou* daily, for twenty-three years, and people found his presence unbearable. The Daoist priest said to him, "In your past life, you indulged in lust and excreted waste in the sacred altar chamber, leaving it unclean and foul. Now you receive this retribution. You must swiftly repent, receive the precepts, and diligently cultivate without regression." Thereupon, the man went before the Daoist priest, sincerely repenting and upholding the fasts and precepts. The priest cast a talisman into water, and after the man drank it, he vomited over a thousand dung beetles, then recovered as before.

Another man daily consumed a handful of foul grass, suffering constant abdominal pain for eight years. The Daoist priest said to him, "In your past life, you devoured living beings, and now you receive this retribution. Simply confess your faults." The man immediately admitted his transgressions, vowing to serve as a lowly servant to the Daoist priest, enduring hardship without complaint. The priest then recited scriptures and administered the precepts. For seven days and nights, he sprayed talismanic water and chanted incantations, and the man transformed into an ox. After a hundred days, the man regained knowledge of his past lives. The priest burned a talisman for refining form and spirit in fire, restoring his original form. From then on, he received the true scriptures and was commanded to uphold them for life.

Such cases are beyond counting. I scatter my Dao-qi without limit, pervading the five billion boundless worlds of the heavens, distributing my numinous essence to establish offices and oversee the registers of life and death for men and women, clearly distinguishing good and evil. In each heaven, there are Heavenly Emperors, the Four Pole Heavenly Masters, the Ten Radiant Perfected, the Life-Inspecting Lads, and the Controllers of Good and Evil, who record merits and sins, knowing even the most minute details. Just as a king governs all under heaven—its people, mountains, rivers, and grasses—so too do I perceive all. Nothing escapes my knowledge.

Pujì asked, "The Heavenly Worthy earlier said that if a ruler faces calamity—war erupting on all sides, celestial bodies falling out of alignment, wind and rain failing to harmonize, crops failing to grow, the people suffering epidemics, and the land in turmoil—when establishing palaces and temples, bearing children, mobilizing armies, or undertaking any endeavor, if misfortune or inauspicious signs arise, one should appeal to me and perform great meritorious deeds: copying scriptures, creating images, establishing temples to ordain people, offering treasures, curios, variegated silks, valuables, gold, silver, pearls, jade, fields, houses, palaces, and gardens as alms, dedicating them to the Three Treasures’ field of blessings; delivering sentient beings, rescuing those in peril, releasing prisoners, holding fasts and precepts, setting up hundreds of high seats, expounding the profound and wondrous meanings of the Great Vehicle, exhorting the people to listen to the Dharma, practicing almsgiving and repentance, and performing inconceivable meritorious deeds of salvation and protection. Yet sentient beings are weak and feeble, their capacities unequal. Even if they cultivate, they may not discern clearly; though they perform one deed, they fear calamities will not be dispelled, wavering in doubt, unable to see clearly. May I ask: do the meritorious deeds of salvation and protection have gradations?"

The Dao Lord answered Pujì, "Salvation and deliverance from calamity fundamentally depend on utmost sincerity; almsgiving and relinquishing wealth test the sincerity of one’s heart. Since sentient beings’ perceptions vary in depth, the power of blessings they attain also differs in weight. Now, I shall roughly explain the five kinds.

The first is creating true images of me, manifesting in response to transformations. Blessings flow through kalpas, and the sublime retribution is boundless. Why? Sentient beings’ deluded thoughts cannot be restrained, but gazing upon my true image gives rise to contemplation. Once contemplation arises, true numen descends to connect; with single-minded devotion, one attains the fruit of non-action. Among deeds of salvation, this is foremost.

The second is copying the scriptural teachings of the Three Caverns and the Great Vehicle. Blessings flow through eternal kalpas, and the merit is infinite. Why? The scriptures are my legacy, guiding the deluded and ignorant, awakening boundless Dao-mind in sentient beings. From delusion arises awakening, and through awakening, one becomes true. All sages cultivate and attain the Dao’s fruit. Among deeds of salvation, this is second.

The third is establishing temples to ordain people, building halls and sanctuaries. Blessings flow through kalpas, and the merit is inconceivable. Why? When one person leaves the household life to maintain scriptures and images, teaching and transforming sentient beings, inspiring them to awaken the Dao-mind, one enlightens ten thousand. Through the wheel of karmic conditions, one assists the state and transforms the people, propagating the Dao and illuminating the Dharma, yielding the greatest benefit. Among deeds of salvation, this is third.

The fourth is observing fasts, practicing the Dao, performing rites of repentance, reciting scriptures, offering praises, and burning incense. The field of blessings is immeasurable. Why? Fasts purify the heart, and the Dao enables resonance. Practicing them atones for sins and aligns with prayers for grace. The merit moves the heavens, dispelling calamities and bestowing blessings. In life and death, one relies on fasts and precepts. Among deeds of salvation, this is fourth.

The fifth is almsgiving in all its forms, an immeasurable field of blessings. The karmic retribution is towering, truly profound and abundant. Why? Wealth is the lifeblood of sentient beings, difficult to relinquish even for oneself. To give up wealth and life without stinginess, broadly establishing merit, universally aiding sentient beings, inwardly stilling miserliness and greed, outwardly eliminating bandits and thieves—this benefits humans and gods, and in life and death, one receives grace. Among deeds of salvation, this is fifth.

Diligently practicing these brings boundless blessings."

*The Upper Scripture of the Numinous Treasure of the Cavern Mystery: Karma and Retribution, Causes and Conditions, Scroll Six* ends here.

The Greatly Compassionate and Universally Salvific Perfected One, Pujì, inquired of the Supreme Dao Lord regarding karma, retribution, causes, and conditions.

At that time, the Supreme Dao Lord told Pujì, "Long ago, at the beginning of the Red Clarity Kalpa, I was at the Southern Vermilion Cavern, beside the Fire-Refining Pool of the Kaiyang Upper Observatory, where I convened a great assembly with the Primordial Heavenly Worthy to expound the Dharma and broadly deliver the heavens."

chunks.original_text: 时四梵天王将诸眷属、无量国人，严持香华，供养三宝。 元始上师并听法诸圣，各住一面。 元始以此因缘，即放眉间千种光明，彻照十方无量国土，普使闻知，同来就会，广阐灵音，遍以功德利益众生？ 是时，东方世界九炁天君将诸眷属、无量国人，来到会中，住其东面； 建十法座，百宝庄严，九光灵盖，十绝灵旛，青旌青旆，青褥青裀，神龙鼓乐，围绕左右； 烧香散华，九光灵烛、四明神灯巨亿万计，照耀於前。 南方世界三炁天君将诸眷属、无量国人，来到会中，住其南面； 建十法座，万种庄严，三明之盖，六合神旛，朱旗朱节，绛席绛裀，九凤丹弦，围绕左右； 烧香散华，华烛四照，莲灯八开巨亿万计，辉焕於前。 西方世界七炁天君将诸眷属、无量国人，来到会中，住其西面； 建十法座，七宝庄严，四转灵旛，十回仙盖，素带皓旗，玉床琼席，白虎铿钟，围绕左右； 烧香散华，霄灯八焰，云烛九光巨亿万计，焕赫於前。 北方世界五炁天君将诸眷属、无量国人，来到会中，住其北面； 建十法座，五色庄严，八道灵膳，七明仙盖，皂旆玄麾，罗纹锦席，玄武击磬，围绕左右； 烧香散华，鸾烛千华，鳞灯万焰，巨亿万计，灿烂於前。 东北世界始青天君将诸眷属、无量国人，来到会中，住其方面； 建十法座，皆以碧玉庄严，碧霞飞盖，碧云灵旛，翠节翠旗，绀裀绀褥，天仙奏乐，围绕左右； 烧香散烨，神烛空明，灵灯浮焰巨亿万计，炜烨於前。 东南世界始丹天君将诸眷属、无量国人，来到会中，住其方面； 建十法座，皆以红宝庄严，红莲华盖，红谷灵旛，红旗红旆，红褥红裀，仙童设乐，围绕左右； 烧香散华，天光九色，灵烟十华，巨亿万计，照耀於前。 西南世界始素天君将诸眷属、无量国人，来到会中，住其方面； 建十法座，皆以缥玉庄严，缥云飞盖，缥映华旛，华幢华节，华裀华席，玉女鼓乐，围绕左右； 烧香散华，浮焰星散，流光华飞，巨亿万计，灼烁於前。 西北世界始玄天君将诸眷属、无量国人，来到会中，住其方面； 建十法座，皆以众宝庄严，轮天飞盖，含景灵旛，紫旆紫麾，绿裀绿席，金童奏乐，围绕左右； 烧香散华，龙烛万焰，鸳灯千照，巨亿万计，散乱於前。 上方世界上元天君将诸圣众、无量天仙来到会中，住其前面； 建十法座，万宝庄严，万色华旛，万量莲盖，龙旗凤节，云锦霜罗，天乐满空，围绕左右； 散华烧香，华灯万焰，莲烛千光，不可称计，遍满於前。 下方世界下元天君将诸眷属、无量国人，来到会中，住其左右； 建十法座，黄玉庄严，空明飞盖，百转灵旛，珠旗玉饰，锦席华裀，飞天奏乐，围绕左右； 散华烧香，金灯万照，琼烛千明，巨亿万计，晃朗於前。 十天到，百宝庄严，内外光明，昭耀天地。 於是，元始乃命慈悲真人、妙觉真人、慈惠真人、惠相真人、明解真人、善觉真人、慈念真人、智观真人、慈爱真人、常乐真人，登东方法座。 慈观真人、等救真人、空惠真人、宝相真人、玄觉真人、空明真人，圆寂真人、等相真人、慈明真人、耀灵真人，登南方法座。 景虚真人、平等真人、大慈真人、好生真人、景上真人、等曜真人、静惠真人、智明真人、妙惠真人、明虚真人，登西方法座。

At that time, the Four Brahmā Heavenly Kings, leading their retinues and countless beings from their realms, reverently held incense and flowers to make offerings to the Three Treasures. The Supreme Master of the Primordial Beginning and all the sagely listeners of the Dharma each took their places on one side. The Primordial Beginning then emitted from between his brows a thousand kinds of radiance, which shone through the ten directions and illuminated boundless lands, universally enabling all to hear and know, that they might come together and assemble, broadly proclaiming the numinous sound to universally benefit beings with merit and virtue.

At that moment, the Nine Qi Heavenly Lord of the Eastern World, leading his retinues and countless beings from his realm, arrived at the assembly and took his place on the eastern side. There he established ten Dharma thrones, adorned with a hundred treasures, crowned with ninefold luminous canopies and tenfold divine banners, with azure standards and azure streamers, azure cushions and azure mats. Divine dragons and celestial music encircled him on all sides. He burned incense and scattered flowers, with ninefold luminous candles and fourfold bright divine lamps numbering in the hundreds of millions, illuminating all before him.

The Three Qi Heavenly Lord of the Southern World, leading his retinues and countless beings from his realm, arrived at the assembly and took his place on the southern side. There he established ten Dharma thrones, adorned with ten thousand kinds of ornaments, crowned with threefold bright canopies and sixfold divine banners, with vermilion flags and vermilion streamers, crimson seats and crimson mats. Nine phoenixes played cinnabar strings, encircling him on all sides. He burned incense and scattered flowers, with floral candles casting light in four directions and eightfold lotus lamps numbering in the hundreds of millions, blazing brilliantly before him.

The Seven Qi Heavenly Lord of the Western World, leading his retinues and countless beings from his realm, arrived at the assembly and took his place on the western side. There he established ten Dharma thrones, adorned with seven treasures, crowned with fourfold revolving divine banners and tenfold turning immortal canopies, with white sashes and luminous flags, jade beds and gem-studded mats. White tigers struck resonant bells, encircling him on all sides. He burned incense and scattered flowers, with rosy dawn lamps casting eightfold flames and cloud candles emitting ninefold radiance numbering in the hundreds of millions, resplendent before him.

The Five Qi Heavenly Lord of the Northern World, leading his retinues and countless beings from his realm, arrived at the assembly and took his place on the northern side. There he established ten Dharma thrones, adorned with five colors, crowned with eightfold divine canopies and sevenfold bright immortal parasols, with black streamers and dark banners, brocade-patterned mats. Black tortoises struck chimes, encircling him on all sides. He burned incense and scattered flowers, with simurgh candles casting a thousand blossoms and scale-patterned lamps emitting ten thousand flames numbering in the hundreds of millions, dazzling before him.

The Lord of the Beginning Azure Heaven of the Northeast World, leading his retinues and countless beings from his realm, arrived at the assembly and took his place in his direction. There he established ten Dharma thrones, all adorned with azure jade, crowned with flying azure canopies and azure cloud banners, with jadeite standards and jadeite flags, indigo mats and indigo cushions. Heavenly immortals played music, encircling him on all sides. He burned incense and scattered brilliant flowers, with divine candles casting empty brightness and numinous lamps emitting floating flames numbering in the hundreds of millions, blazing brilliantly before him.

The Lord of the Beginning Vermilion Heaven of the Southeast World, leading his retinues and countless beings from his realm, arrived at the assembly and took his place in his direction. There he established ten Dharma thrones, all adorned with red treasures, crowned with red lotus canopies and red valley banners, with red flags and red streamers, red mats and red cushions. Immortal youths performed music, encircling him on all sides. He burned incense and scattered flowers, with nine-colored celestial light and tenfold numinous smoke numbering in the hundreds of millions, illuminating all before him.

The Lord of the Beginning Pale Heaven of the Southwest World, leading his retinues and countless beings from his realm, arrived at the assembly and took his place in his direction. There he established ten Dharma thrones, all adorned with pale jade, crowned with pale cloud canopies and pale luminous banners, with floral standards and floral streamers, floral mats and floral seats. Jade maidens played music, encircling him on all sides. He burned incense and scattered flowers, with floating flames scattering like stars and flowing light like flying blossoms numbering in the hundreds of millions, glowing brilliantly before him.

The Lord of the Beginning Dark Heaven of the Northwest World, leading his retinues and countless beings from his realm, arrived at the assembly and took his place in his direction. There he established ten Dharma thrones, all adorned with various treasures, crowned with wheel-turning celestial canopies and luminous banners containing the radiance of the sun, with purple streamers and purple banners, green mats and green seats. Golden youths played music, encircling him on all sides. He burned incense and scattered flowers, with dragon candles emitting ten thousand flames and mandarin-duck lamps casting a thousand lights numbering in the hundreds of millions, scattering brilliance before him.

The Upper Prime Heavenly Lord of the World Above, leading all the sagely hosts and countless heavenly immortals, arrived at the assembly and took his place at the front. There he established ten Dharma thrones, adorned with ten thousand treasures, crowned with ten thousand colored floral banners and ten thousand lotus canopies, with dragon flags and phoenix standards, cloud brocade and frost-like gauze. Celestial music filled the sky, encircling him on all sides. He scattered flowers and burned incense, with floral lamps emitting ten thousand flames and lotus candles casting a thousand lights beyond reckoning, filling all before him.

The Lower Prime Heavenly Lord of the World Below, leading his retinues and countless beings from his realm, arrived at the assembly and took his place on the left and right. There he established ten Dharma thrones, adorned with yellow jade, crowned with empty-brightness flying canopies and hundredfold revolving divine banners, with pearl-ornamented flags and jade decorations, brocade seats and floral mats. Flying immortals played music, encircling him on all sides. He scattered flowers and burned incense, with golden lamps casting ten thousand lights and gem-studded candles emitting a thousand radiance numbering in the hundreds of millions, shining brightly before him.

The ten heavens arrived, adorned with a hundred treasures, their inner and outer brilliance illuminating heaven and earth. Thereupon, the Primordial Beginning commanded the Perfected Ones of Compassion and Mercy, Wondrous Awakening, Compassionate Kindness, Kind Countenance, Luminous Understanding, Good Awakening, Compassionate Mindfulness, Wisdom Contemplation, Compassionate Love, and Constant Joy to ascend the eastern Dharma throne.

The Perfected Ones of Compassionate Contemplation, Equal Salvation, Empty Kindness, Jeweled Countenance, Mysterious Awakening, Empty Brightness, Perfect Quiescence, Equal Countenance, Compassionate Luminosity, and Radiant Numinosity ascended the southern Dharma throne.

The Perfected Ones of Scenic Emptiness, Equality, Great Compassion, Love of Life, Scenic Superiority, Equal Radiance, Tranquil Kindness, Wisdom and Brightness, Wondrous Kindness, and Luminous Emptiness ascended the western Dharma throne.

chunks.original_text: 明皇真人、照理真人、普度真人、至极真人、慈觉真人、金房真人、皇上真人、安乐真人、消灾真人、护命真人，登北方法座。 玉台真人、金玄真人、妙玄真人、自在真人、解脱真人、洞玄真人、救度真人、洞神真人、济苦真人、降魔真人，登东北方法座。 等照真人、金景真人、玉光真人、光明真人、圆静真人、慈救真人、慈照真人、琼华真人、景玄真人、明玄真人，登东南方法座。 明玄真人、明上真人、万道真人、景明真人、景相真人、明觉真人、满相真人、景空真人、景照真人、明法真人，登西南方法座。 景妙真人、景惠真人、化生真人、明梵真人、应感真人、等慈真人、无相真人、太玄真人、万寿真人、太保真人，登西北方法座。 无畏真人、等惠真人、金轮真人、玄上真人、法轮真人、灵宝真人、度命真人、等静真人、无垢真人、玄明真人，登上方法座。 等成真人、等智真人、等爱真人、等玄真人、无等真人、转轮真人、玄通真人、太妙真人、九光真人、普慈真人，登下方法座。 皆着九色离罗之帔，华锦飞裙，戴飞云翔凤之冠，蹑盘龙珠玉之履，凭回鸾紫玉之几，执百宝龙文之拂，各安座如也。 紫房童子并坐飞云宝台，执九光万誊之华，齐唱《太上业报因缘经》； 诸真演说微奥之义，大不可思议功德。 一百日中，灵音华宛，诸天上帝，浮空步虚，持幢建节，烧香散华，奏万种玄歌妙乐，遍满虚空，蔽天光明。 於是静乐国王、逍遥国王、庄严国王、自在国王、胜上国王、无量国王、寿乐国王、智德国王、真宝国王、香山国王、浮香国王、清浄国王、无漏国王等，各持金银珠玉、衣服卧具、车马童仆、玩弄器用千亿万计，同来供养。 散华烧香，左绕三匝，长跪道前，稽首礼拜：臣等一十三王来到会前，观听法音。 又善胜皇后、宝香皇后、金华皇后、福集皇后、玉山皇后、真安皇后、静明皇后、无染皇后、灵通皇后、开明皇后、胜因皇后、妙香皇后、最胜皇后，各持香华幢盖、名衣上服不可称计，同来礼拜，味餐法音。 又有诸国王子百千万亿，各将饮食、上妙华果、金芝玉英巨亿万计，以用供养，观听法音。 复有诸妃后主及小王子数百万人，各将上妙衣服及以冠履宝瓶、香几盘盂器物，同到会中，以用布施，听受法音。 复有大臣宰辅数百万众，各将法食名果、珍味诸宝、器匕香箧、经帕宝香杂物，同来供养，愿听法音。 复有诸男女清信贤者，各持香油、名衣上服、绫罗锦绣、米谷豆麦、床卧几褥、钗梳巾帔、履秸靴鞋、镮钏等具，同来布施，愿听灵音。 有诸道士女冠，各将香华、缘身法服、供养法具，同来听法，布散诸天。 复有天男天女无鞅数众，旋绕法座，烧香散华，行道赞叹，诵咏灵音。 复有玉童玉女，燃九光香灯无量等众，绕座布列，照曜光明。 元始以大神力变此会中，所有法具内外明彻，等一瑠璃，清浄无染。 王及皇后并诸妃主、大臣宰辅、人民男女听法之者，皆同一相，表裹开通，齐悟道真，俱入无为。 南丹国土、山川林木，乃至鸟兽，爰洎昆虫，皆悉平等，获大法音，功德无量，不可思议。 倏欻之间，诸天众圣及诸来者，各还本处，寂尔皆空。 普济曰：今日天尊所说，皆是元始神通威力，非凡能及。

The Perfected Ones of Luminous Sovereignty, Illuminating Principle, Universal Salvation, Supreme Ultimate, Compassionate Awakening, Golden Chamber, August Superiority, Peace and Joy, Disaster-Dispelling, and Life-Protecting ascended the northern Dharma throne.

The Perfected Ones of Jeweled Terrace, Golden Mystery, Wondrous Mystery, Self-Mastery, Liberation, Cavernous Mystery, Salvation, Cavernous Spirit, Suffering-Relieving, and Demon-Quelling ascended the northeastern Dharma throne.

The Perfected Ones of Equal Illumination, Golden Scenery, Jade Radiance, Luminosity, Perfect Quiescence, Compassionate Salvation, Compassionate Illumination, Jeweled Splendor, Scenic Mystery, and Luminous Mystery ascended the southeastern Dharma throne.

The Perfected Ones of Luminous Mystery, Luminous Superiority, Myriad Dao, Scenic Brightness, Scenic Countenance, Luminous Awakening, Complete Countenance, Scenic Emptiness, Scenic Illumination, and Dharma-Illuminating ascended the southwestern Dharma throne.

The Perfected Ones of Scenic Wonder, Scenic Virtue, Transformative Life, Luminous Brahma, Responsive Manifestation, Equal Compassion, Formlessness, Supreme Mystery, Longevity, and Grand Protector ascended the northwestern Dharma throne.

The Perfected Ones of Fearlessness, Equal Virtue, Golden Wheel, Mysterious Superiority, Dharma Wheel, Numinous Treasure, Life-Saving, Equal Quiescence, Immaculacy, and Mysterious Brightness ascended the upper Dharma throne.

The Perfected Ones of Equal Attainment, Equal Wisdom, Equal Love, Equal Mystery, Peerless, Wheel-Turning, Mysterious Penetration, Supreme Wonder, Ninefold Radiance, and Universal Compassion ascended the lower Dharma throne.

All were adorned with nine-colored feathered capes of *li-luo*, embroidered skirts of flying brocade, crowns of soaring clouds and phoenixes, slippers of coiled dragons and pearl jade. They leaned upon purple-jade tables of returning simurghs, wielded fly-whisks inscribed with hundred-jeweled dragon patterns, and each settled into their seats with solemn grace.

The Jade Chamber youths sat upon flying-cloud treasure platforms, holding flowers of ninefold radiance and myriad petals, chanting in unison the *Sutra of Karmic Retribution by the Most High*. The Perfected Ones expounded the subtle and profound meanings, their merit and virtue vast beyond conception.

For a hundred days, ethereal melodies and floral garlands filled the air. The Celestial Emperors and Divine Lords drifted through the void, bearing banners and standards, burning incense and scattering flowers. They performed ten thousand kinds of wondrous celestial songs and music, suffusing the empty sky and veiling the heavens with brilliance.

Then the kings of Serene Joy, Carefree, Adornment, Self-Mastery, Supreme Victory, Boundlessness, Longevity and Joy, Wisdom Virtue, True Treasure, Fragrant Mountain, Floating Fragrance, Purity, and the Immaculate—each bearing gold, silver, pearls, jade, garments, bedding, chariots, horses, servants, and countless treasures—came together to make offerings. They scattered flowers and burned incense, circumambulated thrice to the left, knelt before the Dao, and prostrated in reverence: "We, the thirteen kings, have come before this assembly to behold and listen to the Dharma."

Moreover, the empresses Good Victory, Treasure Fragrance, Golden Splendor, Fortune Gathered, Jade Mountain, True Peace, Serene Brightness, Immaculate, Numinous Penetration, Enlightened, Victorious Cause, Wondrous Fragrance, and Supreme Victory—each bearing incense, flowers, banners, canopies, and countless precious garments—came together to pay homage and savor the Dharma.

Additionally, the princes of the various kings, numbering hundreds of thousands of myriads, each brought fine foods, exquisite flowers and fruits, golden mushrooms and jade blossoms in incalculable quantities to make offerings and listen to the Dharma.

Furthermore, the consorts, queen mothers, and young princes, numbering millions, each brought fine garments, crowns, slippers, jeweled vases, incense tables, trays, and vessels to the assembly to make offerings and receive the Dharma.

Again, the ministers and chief advisors, numbering millions, each brought ritual foods, rare fruits, delicacies, treasures, utensils, incense boxes, scripture wrappers, precious incense, and miscellaneous items to make offerings and wish to hear the Dharma.

Moreover, the faithful laymen and laywomen, each holding fragrant oils, fine garments, silks and brocades, grains, beans, beds, tables, cushions, hairpins, combs, kerchiefs, capes, slippers, boots, rings, and bracelets, came together to make offerings and wish to hear the numinous sounds.

The Daoist priests and nuns, each bearing incense, ritual vestments, and offerings, came to listen to the Dharma and scatter blessings upon the heavens.

Countless celestial youths and maidens circumambulated the Dharma seat, burning incense and scattering flowers, performing rituals and chanting praises, reciting the numinous sounds.

Jade youths and maidens, lighting lamps of ninefold radiance in boundless numbers, encircled the seat in formation, illuminating the assembly with brilliance.

The Primordial Beginning, through great divine power, transformed the assembly so that all Dharma implements, both within and without, became as transparent as lapis lazuli, pure and unstained.

The kings, empresses, consorts, ministers, officials, and all men and women who listened to the Dharma attained a single appearance, their inner and outer selves opened and connected. Together they awakened to the true Dao and entered the formless.

The lands of Southern Cinnabar, its mountains, rivers, forests, and trees—even the birds, beasts, and crawling insects—all equally received the great Dharma sounds. Their merit and virtue were immeasurable, beyond conception.

In an instant, the celestial hosts, sages, and all who had come returned to their original abodes, and all became still and empty.

Universal Salvation said: "What the Heavenly Worthy has spoken today is all through the divine power and majesty of the Primordial Beginning, beyond the reach of ordinary beings."

chunks.original_text: 未审当来讲说及诸功德，其意云何？ 道君曰：吾说以此者，正欲为当来众生启福基也。 凡功德无穷，大略有九，随其分力，各获福田。 今为汝言，宜须谛识。 一者造像，二者写经，三者置观，四者度人，五者建斋，六者诵经，七者持戒，八者供养，九者布施。 或建立殿堂经台、钟阁门楼、廊宇师房、仆役常住、庄田旛华、灯烛钟磬，法具种种营修，皆成功德，无量无边，过去、未来，悉获福利，皆为微妙不可胜言。 然救济危苦，解祸消灾，讲经功德最为第一。 所以者何？ 而发众生无量道性，出诸智慧，清浄六根，悟解无为，证真常道，不生不灭，永断识因，无去无来，湛然空寂，皆因此经得悟，因悟成真。 以是义故，先须讲说。 若帝主国王、皇后大臣、宰辅公侯、人民男女，请诸道士及以女冠，所在发心，立百高座，讲说三洞大乘经典，烧香散华，明灯照耀，布施供养，随力所堪，三日、七日、七七日夜、百日，不计时节，能尽一部、两部，乃至百千万亿部帙卷等，最为利益，不可思议。 普济又问曰：众生劣弱，不能备百，止一座两座乃至十座、二十、三十，随力所堪，未审何如？ 道君曰：吾向说十方世界敷百座者，正欲开悟众生，所以十方，方各一座，甚有深意。 可止随宜。 元始以一炁化生三才，生天立地，运用五行，生成万象，布炁十方； 人生其内，秉质养形，悉因其化，外资一气，内构五常，表裹相因，而立五德。 众生结阴，内外包罗，十月出胎，周回十气，气运生化，百节开张。 一一方中，气成十结； 一一结内，皆有一神？ 结习相因，罪累缠缚。 和此百神，故立百真，而张百座。 故一一方内建十法座，一一座上有一真人，正为众生解其缠结。 若众生结解，深悟道源，言说亦无，岂须讲说。 如未悟之时，要资百也。 犹若世间将如击贼，须召千兵，及其散已，一兵不用也。 应感品第十七 道君曰：昔尊胜国王舍位出家，入山学道；

chunks.original_text: 十二年中，太上真人下授与经法，赐以神丹，寿得三万岁，得成真人。 多宝国王常於宫中持经奉戒，烧香礼诵； 十六年中，东华真人常为说法，教以延年，寿七万岁，得成真人。 满相皇后弃舍宫掖，出家学道； 三十五年，玄和玉女朝夕捧接，赐其真经。 修行不怠，寿二万岁，入蓬莱山中，今为真妃。 妙相皇后常诵此经戒，至念在心； 二十八年，金华玉女下授仙经，一百年中，因水劫化形，转身为男子，更受经法，万百千年，得为真人。 多喜王子出家学道，诵念此经； 六十年中，金光童子为送衣食。 寿香王子出家诵经，五十七年，天降神香，不焚自馨。 又有大臣出家诵经，八十九年，凤凰来降，口吐灵音。 昔有男子居家诵经，昼夜不倦，四十三年，庭前生莲华，中有百味香果饮食。 又有男子山中修道，诵念真经，六年之中，龙王下降，送其衣食。 又有女人入山学道，诵念此经，三年之后，白虎来侍卫其经堂。 又有女子居家诵经，二十年中，衣食自然。 又有道士山栖独坐，诵念此经，九年之中，两凤常侍左右，为送香灯，供给所须。 又有道士居家诵经，二十三年，天男下降，给其衣食。 又有女冠入山修道，诵念此经，二十一年，天女侍卫，供给衣食。 又有国王持斋奉戒，礼拜烧香，三十三年，长生真人赐其仙丹，寿命无穷。 又有皇后持斋礼拜，奉戒烧香，五十年中，青腰玉女迎入云中。 又有王子持斋奉戒，礼拜烧香，七十三年，金华童子下赐仙芝。 又有大臣持斋礼拜，奉戒烧香，十八年中，灵龟负药，送至座前。 又有道士长斋奉戒，礼拜烧香，八十三年，天王保举，升入云中。 又有女冠长斋奉戒，散华烧香，一百一年，五帝玉女迎入金华。 又有男子持斋礼拜，烧香燃灯，九十三年，地只侍卫。 又有女子持斋礼拜，烧香散华，九十八年，三界司迎。 又有国王置观度人，写经造像，建诸功德； 十六年中，五帝来降，赐以金芝、凤凰鸾鹤、麒麟奇兽、甘露醴泉、灵芝神草，遍满郊畿。 又有皇后广行布施，入诸灵观出家法身，斋戒烧香，幢旛宝盖种种福田； 三年之中，发白反黑，还如少童； 生诸贵子，聪明智慧，悉统王位，仁者贤明。 又有贤者造诸法服，奉上道士出家法身，八年之中，五谷丰饶，所向从心。 又有贤者常供斋食，奉献道士及以贤人，六年之中，衣食丰饶。 又有男女常将财物施入常住，供养十方三宝，二十四年，五谷自生，天蚕降素。 又有女子救济贫乏，放赎生命，大行慈悲，二十七年，玉女迎将入於云中。 又有女子供养出家法衣法食，三十九年，天赐黄金。 又有女子缝裁旛像、出家法服，斋戒供具，不倦苦辛，四十年中，天降玉英。 又有贤者造钟造磬，送诸灵观； 二十五年，地出黄金，年命长远。 又有贤者，常以五谷施诸常住，作其芽孽，十一年中，衣食自饶。 又有贤者常於玄坛灵观洗饰尊像，修诸经教，施香及华； 十七年中，门户兴隆。 又有贤者布施手工，抄写经教，十八年中，聪明智慧，子胤繁昌。 如此等辈，粗陈要领，以示将来，若玄都金格感应之篇，终劫说之，亦不能究。 福报品第十八 道君曰：造像写经者，见世得尊胜，过去生天王门身。 立观度人者，见世得豪贵，过去生国王身。

Over the course of twelve years, the Most High Perfected Being descended to bestow upon him the scriptures and methods, granting him divine elixir. His lifespan extended to thirty thousand years, and he attained the rank of Perfected Being. The King of Many Treasures constantly upheld the scriptures and observed the precepts within his palace, burning incense and reciting in reverence. For sixteen years, the Perfected Being of Eastern Florescence regularly expounded the Dharma to him, teaching him the way to prolong life. His lifespan reached seventy thousand years, and he attained the rank of Perfected Being.

Empress Mǎnxiàng abandoned the palace chambers to leave the household life and cultivate the Dao. For thirty-five years, the Jade Maiden of Mystic Harmony attended her morning and evening, presenting her with the true scriptures. Through unwavering practice, her lifespan extended to twenty thousand years, and she entered Mount Penglai, where she now serves as a Perfected Consort.

Empress Miàoxiàng constantly recited these scriptures and precepts, her mindfulness ever present in her heart. After twenty-eight years, the Jade Maiden of Golden Florescence descended to bestow upon her the immortal scriptures. Over the course of a hundred years, she transformed her form through the water kalpa, turning her body into that of a man. She received the scriptures and methods anew, and after ten thousand hundred thousand years, she attained the rank of Perfected Being.

Prince Duōxǐ left the household life to cultivate the Dao, reciting and contemplating these scriptures. For sixty years, the Golden Radiance Youth provided him with clothing and food. Prince Shòuxiāng left the household life to recite the scriptures, and after fifty-seven years, divine incense descended from heaven, fragrant without burning.

There was also a great minister who left the household life to recite the scriptures. After eighty-nine years, phoenixes descended, their mouths emitting numinous sounds. Once there was a man who recited the scriptures at home, day and night without weariness. After forty-three years, lotuses bloomed in his courtyard, bearing a hundred flavors of fragrant fruits and beverages.

Another man cultivated the Dao in the mountains, reciting and contemplating the true scriptures. Within six years, the Dragon King descended to provide him with clothing and food. A woman entered the mountains to cultivate the Dao, reciting and contemplating these scriptures. After three years, a white tiger came to guard her scripture hall.

A woman recited the scriptures at home for twenty years, and her clothing and food came naturally. A Daoist dwelled alone in the mountains, reciting and contemplating these scriptures. Over nine years, a pair of phoenixes constantly attended him on either side, bringing incense and lamps, supplying all his needs.

A Daoist recited the scriptures at home for twenty-three years, and a heavenly youth descended to provide him with clothing and food. A female Daoist entered the mountains to cultivate the Dao, reciting and contemplating these scriptures. After twenty-one years, heavenly maidens attended and provided her with clothing and food.

A king observed fasts and upheld the precepts, bowing in worship and burning incense. After thirty-three years, the Perfected Being of Longevity bestowed upon him the immortal elixir, granting him an endless lifespan. A queen observed fasts, bowed in worship, upheld the precepts, and burned incense. Over fifty years, the Jade Maiden of Azure Waist welcomed her into the clouds.

A prince observed fasts and upheld the precepts, bowing in worship and burning incense. After seventy-three years, the Golden Florescence Youth descended to bestow upon him immortal lingzhi. A great minister observed fasts, bowed in worship, upheld the precepts, and burned incense. Over eighteen years, a numinous tortoise bore medicine to his seat.

A Daoist observed long fasts and upheld the precepts, bowing in worship and burning incense. After eighty-three years, the Heavenly King recommended him, and he ascended into the clouds. A female Daoist observed long fasts and upheld the precepts, scattering flowers and burning incense. After one hundred and one years, the Jade Maidens of the Five Emperors welcomed her into Golden Florescence.

A man observed fasts, bowed in worship, burned incense, and lit lamps. After ninety-three years, earth spirits attended him. A woman observed fasts, bowed in worship, burned incense, and scattered flowers. After ninety-eight years, the Controllers of the Three Realms welcomed her.

A king established temples to deliver sentient beings, copied scriptures, created images, and performed various meritorious deeds. Over sixteen years, the Five Emperors descended to bestow upon him golden lingzhi, phoenixes, simurghs, luan birds, qilin, rare beasts, sweet dew, sweet springs, divine lingzhi, and numinous herbs, filling the outskirts of his capital.

A queen widely practiced almsgiving, entered numinous temples to leave the household life and embody the Dharma-body, observed fasts, burned incense, and erected banners, canopies, and various fields of merit. Within three years, her white hair turned black again, restoring her youthful appearance. She bore noble children, wise and intelligent, all of whom ruled as kings, benevolent and sagacious.

A worthy person crafted various Dharma robes and offered them to Daoists who had left the household life to embody the Dharma-body. Over eight years, the five grains flourished abundantly, and all his wishes were fulfilled. A worthy person constantly provided vegetarian meals, offering them to Daoists and the virtuous. Over six years, his clothing and food were abundant.

Men and women constantly donated wealth to the permanent endowments, supplying the Three Treasures of the ten directions. Over twenty-four years, the five grains grew spontaneously, and heavenly silkworms descended with silk. A woman relieved the poor and destitute, ransomed lives, and greatly practiced compassion. After twenty-seven years, a jade maiden welcomed her into the clouds.

A woman supplied clothing and food to those who had left the household life. After thirty-nine years, heaven bestowed upon her yellow gold. A woman sewed banners, images, and robes for those who had left the household life, providing vegetarian meals and offerings without weariness or hardship. Over forty years, heaven sent down jade blossoms.

A worthy person cast bells and chimes, sending them to numinous temples. After twenty-five years, the earth yielded yellow gold, and his lifespan extended far. A worthy person constantly offered the five grains to the permanent endowments, sprouting them as seedlings. Over eleven years, his clothing and food were naturally abundant.

A worthy person constantly washed and adorned the revered images at the numinous altars, repaired the scriptural teachings, and offered incense and flowers. Over seventeen years, his household flourished. A worthy person donated manual labor to copy the scriptural teachings. Over eighteen years, he became wise and intelligent, and his descendants prospered.

Such are these examples, roughly outlining the essentials to instruct future generations. Even if the *Responsive Manifestations in the Golden Registers of the Mystic Capital* were expounded for an entire kalpa, they could not be exhausted.

chunks.original_text: 行道诵念者，见世善神保护，过去生聪明身。 持斋礼拜者，见世得安乐，过去生富饶身。 奉戒烧香者，见世诸天敬护，过去生人中形容具足身。 布施经像者，见世得昌炽，过去生富贵身。 布施斋供者，见世多衣食，过去生端正身。 布施贫穷者，见世无灾厄，过去生豪胜身。 不啖食众生者，见世无病苦，过去生长命身。 不饮酒猖狂者，见世神明保佑，过去生忠贞身。 不食荤辛者，见世得芳香，过去生清浄身。 放赎生命者，见世无枉横，过去生恭敬身。 供养出家者，见世人敬仰，过去生贵重身。 说法教化者，见世人礼敬，过去生出家身。 夫功德报应，如响之应声，形之对影，大小清浊，终不差也。 凡夫愚迷，不识因缘宿命，不信罪福吉凶，不知此身从先身种福田中来，不知此身暂生即灭，不知此身总是浮假，不知此身念念无常； 秪恣悭贪，杀生偷盗，邪淫放荡，啖食众生，锜言妄语，诽毁经教，多聚资财； 常谓此生千年不死。 开眼作造罪业无数，闭眼则入地狱轮回。 终日造罪，未曾忏悔，不能发一念善心，作过去、见在、未来受生之福。 自度己身种其芽孽，惟念子孙，愁其不活也。 且世人生炁溘断，哭泣少时，便自忧子孙男女，讵忆父母养育之恩。 无始以来，递相仿习，更无一悟，几许愚痴。 吾念汝辈愚愚相习，永不自觉，故示罪福宿命因缘，令出离苦恼爱欲河中。 而众生流浪，沉沦苦海。 此世界者名曰弃贤宛离天境，亦曰杂报世界，染欲爱天。 生堕其中，暂生即灭，暂聚即散，如彼电光，须臾顷耳； 不浄臭秽，生老病死，痛痒疼酸，饥寒暑湿，水火刀兵，魔精鬼贼，毒风恶注，交相中害，念念死亡，曾不暂住，苦恼几何。 目前见事，身自缠绕，尚不觉知，岂肯信有诸天道境，福地神仙，长生不死，自在无为。 我观世之受生，促於蜉蝣； 世之安居，迫於毫毛； 世之臭处，，甚於厕秽； 世之快乐，何异粪虫，犹自不知，常为恶业，岂不苦哉。 太上洞玄灵宝业报因缘经卷之七竟 太上洞玄灵宝业报因缘经卷之八
chunks.translated_text:
Those who perform the Dao and recite the scriptures in this life are protected by benevolent spirits and are reborn in the future with a wise and intelligent form. Those who observe fasts and perform prostrations in this life attain peace and happiness and are reborn in the future with a prosperous form. Those who uphold the precepts and burn incense in this life are revered and guarded by all the heavens and are reborn in the future with a complete and perfect human form. Those who offer scriptures and images in this life attain flourishing prosperity and are reborn in the future with a noble and wealthy form. Those who offer vegetarian meals and alms in this life enjoy abundant clothing and food and are reborn in the future with an upright and handsome form. Those who relieve the poor and destitute in this life are free from disasters and calamities and are reborn in the future with a powerful and victorious form. Those who refrain from consuming sentient beings in this life are free from illness and suffering and are reborn in the future with a long-lived form. Those who abstain from drunkenness and recklessness in this life are protected by divine spirits and are reborn in the future with a loyal and steadfast form. Those who abstain from pungent and meat-based foods in this life attain fragrance and are reborn in the future with a pure and clean form. Those who liberate and ransom lives in this life are free from unjust harm and are reborn in the future with a revered form. Those who make offerings to renunciates in this life are respected by others and are reborn in the future with a noble and esteemed form. Those who expound the Dharma and teach others in this life are honored by others and are reborn in the future as renunciates.

The rewards of merit and retribution are like an echo responding to sound, or a shadow following form—great or small, pure or turbid, they never deviate. Yet ordinary beings, deluded and ignorant, fail to recognize the causes and conditions of past lives. They do not believe in the consequences of sin and blessings, fortune and misfortune. They do not know that this present body arises from the field of blessings sown in a past life. They do not know that this body, once born, is already perishing; that this body is entirely transient and illusory; that this body is momentary and impermanent. Instead, they indulge in greed and stinginess, killing living beings, stealing, engaging in sexual misconduct and dissipation, consuming sentient beings, uttering harsh and deceitful words, slandering the scriptural teachings, and amassing wealth. They constantly assume they will live a thousand years in this life. With eyes open, they commit countless sins; with eyes closed, they enter the hells and cycle through rebirth. They spend their days creating sins, never repenting, unable to generate even a single thought of goodness to cultivate blessings for past, present, or future lives. They seek only to preserve their own bodies, planting the seeds of suffering, and worry only for their descendants, fearing they may not survive. Yet when the qi of life in this world is suddenly severed, they weep briefly, then fret over their sons and daughters, forgetting the kindness of their parents’ nurturing care. From beginningless time, they have imitated one another, never awakening—how profoundly foolish!

I pity you, who persist in such delusion, never awakening to yourselves. Thus, I reveal the causes and conditions of past lives, the consequences of sin and blessings, so that you may escape the river of suffering and desire. Yet sentient beings drift and drown in the sea of suffering. This world is called the *Realm of the Forsaken and the Wise*, also known as the *World of Mixed Retribution* or the *Heaven of Desire and Attachment*. Those born into it perish as soon as they arise, scatter as soon as they gather—like lightning, fleeting in an instant. It is impure, foul, and filthy, filled with birth, aging, illness, and death; pain, itching, and soreness; hunger, cold, heat, and dampness; water, fire, blades, and weapons; demonic spirits, ghosts, and thieves; poisonous winds and malevolent influences, all mutually harming one another. Death comes in every moment, never pausing for even an instant—how much suffering there is! Even the afflictions they see before their eyes, which entangle their own bodies, they fail to recognize. How then could they believe in the celestial realms, the blessed lands of immortals, the Dao of long life and deathlessness, or the freedom of non-action?

I observe that the lives of those born into this world are shorter than that of a mayfly; their dwellings are more cramped than a hair’s breadth; their foulness exceeds that of a latrine; their pleasures differ not from those of dung-beetles. Yet they remain unaware, perpetuating evil deeds—how could this not be suffering?

*The Supreme Scripture of the Dao and Its Virtue on the Causes and Conditions of Karmic Retribution, Scroll Seven (Conclusion)*

chunks.original_text: 生神品第十九 大慈大悲普济真人，以业报因缘请问太上。 尔时，太上道君曰：吾以道炁开张天地，剖判阴阳，运化因缘，生成万物，分神布炁，养育人民。 从始至终，经营生死，念念不停，食以元和。 汝等凡夫，谁能识之。 吾今为汝剖析因缘，欲使当来悟其元起。 人始受身，皆从虚无自然中来，回黄转白，构气凝精，而元父生神，玄母成形，承天顺地，合化阴阳。 两半因缘，禀其骨肉，莫不资其昔业，会遇今缘，取像乾坤，含怀日月，阴阳变化，神识往来。 万化之中，人最为贵，故始入胎中，三炁潜凝，九天冥运：一月为胞，郁单无量天炁下浃身中； 二月为胎，上上禅善无量寿天炁下浃身中； 三月魂具，梵监须延天炁下浃身中； 四月魄成，寂然兜术天炁下浃身中； 五月生脏，波罗尼密不骄乐天炁下浃身中； 六月化腑，洞玄化应声天炁下浃身中； 七月明窍，灵化梵辅天炁下浃身中； 八月景附，高虚清明天炁下浃身中； 九月神降，无想无结无爱天炁下浃身中。 天神一万八千，身神一万八千，内外相合，三万六千神。 一时生神，金楼玉阁、紫户青门，分灵布化，匝绕身中，表裹相应。 声尚神具，十月而生。 人在胞胎之中，三元养育，九炁布化，昼夜不停，转变昔神，受质今身。 始在胞中，悉知前生善恶因缘，察生所由； 及食秽浊，稍自忘之。 头圆象天，足方象地，左眼为日，右眼为月，发为星辰，眉为华盖，鼻为天门，口为地户，耳为天窗，顶为昆仑，项为天柱，五脏为五岳，四肢为四海，皮肤骨节、血脉关机，法天象地，含阴吐阳。 生神布化，各有司存：脑为泥丸，太一帝君； 心为绛官，司命受生； 肝为青宫，无英制魂； 肺为素宫，白元营魄； 肾为玄宫，桃康纳精； 脾为黄庭，黄帝化灵。 少阳炁化，木精岁星，纳化身中为肝，三魂处之； 上出於目，侍卫九人，镇守九千神。 肝有七叶，主其毛发，荣卫皮肤。 太阳气变，火精荧惑，纳化身中为心，火神居之； 上出为舌，侍卫三人，镇守三千神。 心有三叶，七孔三毛，状若莲华，主其神气暖温，荣卫百神。 少阴炁化，金精太白，纳化身中为肺，七魄主之； 上出於鼻，侍卫七人，镇守七千神。 肺有八叶，主其牙齿，营护筋骨。 太阴气化，水精辰星，纳化身中为肾，左有玉童，右有玉女； 精化之庭，上出於耳，侍卫五人，镇守五千神。 肾有其二，如半月状，主其精液，营护血髓。 元黄气化，土精镇星，纳化身中为脾，意志所出； 上出於口，侍卫十二人，镇守万二千神。 脾长五寸，主其肌肉，营护四肢。 周流百体而生百神，各有名字，出入诸天，变化不测，往返靡停。 人能知之，即得长生； 行坐诵忆，营护身形，消除万祸，制伏百精。 发神玄光，顶神通天，顶前神朱阳，顶后神玄冥，顶左神青光，顶右神白章，额神天庭，左眉神翠童，右眉神羽童，左眼神日光，右眼神月光，左顾神玉阙，右顾神玉梁，左鼻神通阳，右鼻神通阴，口左神命童，口右神天粮，齿神玉关，左牙神天钟，右牙神天磬，舌神赤童，上唇神亭盖，下唇神静舆，左颐神黄父，右颐神黄母，项左神天通，项右神升平，左肩神远山，右肩神远安，左肘神飞龙，右肘神伏虎，左手神天丁，右手神天驺，左指神甲卒，右指神御凶，左腋神扶干，右腋神扶刀，左肋神卫边，右肋神防非，腰左神洞开，腰右神摇亭，左股神玄狱，右股神玄山，左膝神转生，右膝神曲亭，左胫神天柱，右胫神天关，左脚神轮空，右脚神运虚，左踝神幽狐，右踝神伏狼，胸神天田，腹神包灵，阴神几关，尻神幽关，背神紫房，脊神通平，脐神中平，皮神包罗，肉神卫非，骨神内丁；

chunks.original_text: 各长七寸，如赤子状，在人身中纳气成神，荣卫流通，运化自然，与天地合德，出入人身，奏善辍恶，日夜不停。 夫人不生则无，已生则备天地之象，含阴吐阳，悬命由天； 天与其算四万三千二百日，凡一百二十年，算主一日，记在诸天。 吾常勑诸天帝，命召五帝、三界、四司、南斗北斗、十天将军、九土使者、七神童子、八部天神一切神灵，游行人间，检较罪福，男女吉凶。 又遣上圣高尊妙行真人、天仙飞仙、神仙地仙、五岳四渎、日月星辰、三官九府二万四千灵司，建节持旛，飞空步虚，执符把箓，较勘巡行； 三日一言，七日一奏，百日一结，不辍须臾。 若修善力者，诸天童子、司命司录，即为延年，消灾散祸，衣食丰盈。 若造罪积恶者，则诸天帝主使六天魔王捉下魂魄，上诣三官。 若不满算纪者，皆是造罪所致。 终其算纪者，积善所臻也。 故人欲终亡之时，皆是地司上奏诸天，诸天按察，依其部籍，定其死名，勑下三界官属，四司五帝收其魂魄，绝其生气矣。 凡人有疾病、刑厄凶祸、官灾牢狱、水火刀兵种种苦恼，皆是冥司考罚。 当此之时，能广建福田，修斋持戒，诵经行道，烧香散华，讲读礼忏，布施发心，放赎生命，救济贫穷，拔度危厄，写经造像，受戒忏悔，礼谢十方。 先造救苦天尊及度厄灵旛，保命灵旛，延筹灵旛，续命灵旛，禳灾灵旛； 抄写此经，昼夜念诵，首谢诸天，三日、七日乃至百日； 舍家资财宝货、田宅僮仆、绫罗、上妙锦绮、车马珍玩、名衣上服、器具帱帐，种种布施，跪对诸天，首谢所犯。 三官则放其魂魄，延年益算，使得更生。 若天命将终，天算将尽，不可救拔，舍身太阴，临终之时，为其发愿忏悔，舍施衣服、卧具所有资财，受戒忏悔，最得功德，不可思议。 即从初亡至七日以来，造经造像，设斋行道，礼诵忏悔，烧香燃灯，放生赎命，济度贫穷，昼夜相继，开度亡人，克得生天。 所以者何？ 夫人欲亡，乃至七日以来，诸天童子、四司五帝、三界官属齐来监临，按检罪福，列奏天官。 吾遣七神童子复来检行，定其善恶，配注生门。 善即生天，福流子孙，使见在安乐，无怖无畏，家宅清浄，所为皆吉。 恶即受罪殃流，生人死亡，疾病坎坷，官灾、口舌，种种恐怖，惑乱生人，凡所施为皆悉不利。 是故七日之内，开度最急。 过是之后，每至七日，是其童子领录亡人魂魄来到家中，案行罪福。 七七之后，五天将军下摄其魂，九土使者来取其魄，将军欲其生天，使者欲其入地； 五日一下，较量罪福，福多者则生天堂，罪多者则入地狱。 凡善恶两神，十日一下，考较善恶，定其罪福。 是故亡人从初亡、一七、二七乃至七七、百日，家中亲眷当须开度，今生善处，得见安乐。 作此功德，最为第一。 即初亡、一七，造救苦天尊一身，写此经一部，造灵旛一口，燃灯七卮。 至二七，造天尊二躯，写经二部，造旛二口，燃灯二七卮。 计七日，造像七躯，写经七部，造旛七口，燃灯四十九卮。 计日加之，至百日，造像百躯，写经百部，及转经百遍，造旛百口，燃灯七百卮也。 虽则百千万亿经像、旛灯，要以七数之。 若贫穷之人，随其分力，皆就七百日也。 道君曰：七神童子者，天中北斗之精也。

Each spirit spans seven inches, appearing in the form of an infant. Within the human body, they absorb qi to become spirits, ensuring the flow of *rong* and *wei* and the natural transformation of qi. In harmony with the virtue of Heaven and Earth, they enter and exit the body, promoting good and halting evil, ceaselessly day and night.

When a person is unborn, they do not exist; once born, they embody the image of Heaven and Earth, inhaling yin and exhaling yang, their fate suspended by Heaven. Heaven grants them a lifespan of forty-three thousand two hundred days—one hundred and twenty years—with each day recorded by the Lord of Destiny and inscribed in the registers of the various heavens.

I have often commanded the Emperors of the Heavens to summon the Five Emperors, the Three Realms, the Four Offices, the Southern and Northern Dippers, the Ten Heavenly Generals, the Nine Earth Envoys, the Seven Divine Lads, the Eight Divisions of Heavenly Spirits, and all divine beings to roam the mortal world, inspecting and assessing sins and blessings, the fortunes and misfortunes of men and women.

I have also dispatched the Most Sacred and Exalted Perfected Ones of Wondrous Conduct, the Heavenly Immortals, Flying Immortals, Divine Immortals, Earthbound Immortals, the Five Sacred Peaks, the Four Waterways, the Sun, Moon, and Stars, the Three Officials, the Nine Bureaus, and the twenty-four thousand spirit offices. They bear standards and banners, soar through the void, wield talismans and registers, and patrol ceaselessly. Every three days, they report once; every seven days, they memorialize; every hundred days, they conclude—without pause for even a moment.

For those who cultivate goodness and power, the Heavenly Lads and the Offices of Life and Record immediately extend their years, dispel disasters, and scatter misfortunes, ensuring abundant clothing and food. For those who commit sins and accumulate evil, the Heavenly Emperors dispatch the Demon Kings of the Six Heavens to seize their souls and present them before the Three Officials. If their allotted lifespan is not yet complete, it is due to the sins they have committed. Those who fulfill their destined span do so through the accumulation of goodness.

Thus, when a person nears the end of life, it is because the Earthly Offices have memorialized the Heavens, and the Heavens, upon inspection, determine their death according to the celestial registers. They then command the officials of the Three Realms and the Four Offices, along with the Five Emperors, to collect the soul and sever the breath of life.

Whenever a person suffers illness, punishment, calamity, official disasters, imprisonment, water or fire, blades or weapons, or any manner of suffering, it is the result of the underworld’s examination and punishment. At such times, one should broadly establish fields of blessing: perform purification rites, uphold precepts, recite scriptures, practice the Dao, burn incense, scatter flowers, lecture on and recite repentances, make offerings, cultivate resolve, release and redeem lives, aid the poor, rescue those in peril, copy scriptures, create images, receive precepts, repent, and pay homage to the ten directions.

First, create the Savior from Suffering Heavenly Worthy, the Banner of Deliverance from Calamity, the Banner of Life Protection, the Banner of Lifespan Extension, the Banner of Life Continuation, and the Banner of Disaster Dispelling. Copy this scripture, recite it day and night, and for three, seven, or even a hundred days, offer repentance to the Heavens. Donate family wealth—treasures, goods, fields, dwellings, servants, silks, fine brocades, carriages, horses, rare curios, fine garments, utensils, bedding, and curtains—kneeling before the Heavens to repent for transgressions. The Three Officials will then release the soul, extend life, and increase the allotted span, allowing rebirth.

If Heaven’s mandate is nearing its end and the celestial tally is nearly exhausted, it cannot be saved. Yet if one, in the realm of the Great Yin, at the hour of death, makes vows, repents, donates clothing, bedding, and all possessions, receives precepts, and repents, the merit gained is inconceivable. From the moment of death until the seventh day, create scriptures and images, hold purification feasts, practice the Dao, recite repentances, burn incense, light lamps, release and redeem lives, aid the poor, and continue these acts day and night to deliver the deceased, enabling them to ascend to Heaven.

Why is this so? From the moment of death until the seventh day, the Heavenly Lads, the Four Offices, the Five Emperors, and the officials of the Three Realms all come to oversee, inspecting sins and blessings, and reporting to the Heavenly Offices. I dispatch the Seven Divine Lads to re-examine their conduct, determine good and evil, and assign them to the Gate of Life. If good, they ascend to Heaven, their blessings flowing to descendants, ensuring present peace, freedom from fear, a pure household, and success in all endeavors. If evil, they suffer calamity, their sins flowing to descendants, causing death, illness, misfortune, official disasters, slander, manifold terrors, and confusion in life—all undertakings will fail.

Thus, the seven days following death are the most critical for deliverance. After this period, every seventh day, the Divine Lads record the soul of the deceased and return to the household to review sins and blessings. After forty-nine days, the Five Heavenly Generals descend to seize the soul, and the Nine Earth Envoys come to take the *po*. The Generals wish to send them to Heaven, while the Envoys wish to send them to Earth. Every five days, they weigh sins and blessings; those with more blessings ascend to Heaven, while those with more sins descend to Hell. The two spirits of good and evil descend every ten days to examine and determine sins and blessings.

Therefore, from the moment of death, the first seven days, the second seven days, up to the forty-ninth day and the hundredth day, the deceased’s family must perform deliverance rites to ensure rebirth in a good place and attain peace. This is the foremost act of merit. On the first seventh day, create one image of the Savior from Suffering Heavenly Worthy, copy one section of this scripture, make one spirit banner, and light seven lamps. By the second seventh day, create two images of the Heavenly Worthy, copy two sections of the scripture, make two banners, and light fourteen lamps. By the seventh day, create seven images, copy seven sections of the scripture, make seven banners, and light forty-nine lamps. Increase these accordingly until the hundredth day, when one hundred images, one hundred sections of the scripture (recited one hundred times), one hundred banners, and seven hundred lamps are made. Though the number of scriptures, images, banners, and lamps may reach hundreds of thousands or millions, they must adhere to the number seven. For the poor, adjust according to their means, but aim for seven hundred days.

The Dao Lord said: The Seven Divine Lads are the essence of the Northern Dipper in Heaven.

chunks.original_text: 人始在胎中，七月之时，下人身中，开明七窍，记名斗中：一曰天蓬，二日天内，三日天冲，四曰天辅，五曰天禽，六曰天心，七曰天柱。 各乘飞云七明之车，五彩之衣，从十方童子，神仙兵马各七亿万众，常在人间，分身教化； 或长或短，或男或女，执符把录，较定罪福、善恶因缘，毫分无差。 人能知之，不死长生矣。 道君曰：复有八神童子。 一者金华童子，神名天元，主天子、储君、妃后宗庙，革故改新，立君易主，献可替否，贡赋征税，资财珍宝，车马服饰，宫殿苑囿，池台楼阁，爵禄命召，出入行来。 二者黄灵童子，神名天女，主宅舍坟墓，六畜稼穑，仓库男女，寿夭疾病，建立土功，山川溪谷。 三者清灵童子，神名天威，主车船道路，林木华果，雷电风雨。 四者明灵童子，神名天生，主井鳌门户，沟渠厕溷，不浄淫秽，绮妄不实。 五者丹灵童子，神名天光，主牢狱系闭，文书产乳，血光火灾。 六者玄灵童子，神名天通，主算命延促，妖精魍魉，咒诅祷祀，一切鬼神。 七者紫灵童子，神名天成，主幽魂飞爽，游尸死客，地狱沉沦。 八者素灵童子，神名天昌，主父母男女，夫妻生育。 是八神童子，或依风雨云雷，乘龙驾虎，出入人间，伺其善恶； 若善则应吉，恶则应凶，随其缘分，终不差忒。 汝等男女，但当读诵此经，是八神童子即来拥护，降福消灾，灭除罪咎，不可思议。 道君曰：人之受生，未有不从先业来者。 故禀神挺质，各有因缘； 罪神吉凶，悉从其业。 所以夭寿贵贱，穷通好丑，贫富愚智，等各不同，乃至鸟兽虫鱼、鸡犬草木，亦复然也。 汝等男女，宜各思之。 道君曰：人生受身，甚难逢遇，一朝败坏，万劫何期。 吾故恒行诚劝汝等勤修斋戒、行道诵经、礼拜烧香、燃灯布施、启愿忏悔、济生度死、造像写经、立观度人种种方便者，执为众生作当来福业。 吾故岂有所求乎。 道君曰：昔妙范国王身死，请道士尊德三百六十人来到宫中，忏悔受戒，舍其衣服玩弄、卧具帱帐、金银车马、宝盖绫罗、锦绮器具、僮仆，总入灵观玄坛女冠道士，至诚感彻，诸天大悦。 吾遣好生真人乘三轮凤车，仙童玉女迎入火炼池中，炼其真形。 三年之中，更生王宫。 十四年，还绍王位，大发道心，广建功德，寿七百年。 吾遣玄通真人坐莲华座、飞云之舆，迎入方诸宫中，令学经法，寿得八千岁，今为青华侍童。 同华国王身死，请道士四万六千人，转经行道，造像写经，度人立观，烧香散华，并作生神五炼。 一百日中，吾遣化命真人与八风使者、雷电将军，夜中来迎，登云龙之舆，度入南昌宫中，更修经法。 一万年中，得为火光真人，主此火池。 昔有贤者，命终之时，家人请道士女冠忏悔受戒，即时亡者承此经威力，不经地狱，即得受生於贤善之门。 又有女子身亡，家中父母眷属造像造经，作旛华盖，广燃灯烛，转诵此经，建斋行道，夜后观想，昼夜不倦，布施放生，救贫度厄，烧香散华。 一百年中，吾遣司命返其魂神。 复还家中，大建功德，供养三宝，咨求道士，请受真经，寿得三百年。 吾遣化命真人下度，风火炼形，返为男子身。 入金华山中，服御仙丹，七万余年，令得升为西灵宫中，为无上法师矣。
chunks.translated_text:
When a person first resides in the womb, at the seventh month, the Seven Divine Lads descend into the body, opening and illuminating the seven apertures. Their names are recorded in the Northern Dipper: the first is Heavenly Canopy, the second Heavenly Interior, the third Heavenly Charge, the fourth Heavenly Assistance, the fifth Heavenly Quail, the sixth Heavenly Heart, and the seventh Heavenly Pillar. Each rides a sevenfold-brilliant cloud chariot, clad in five-colored garments, accompanied by divine lads from the ten directions, with legions of immortals, soldiers, and horses numbering seventy million each. They constantly dwell among humans, manifesting in various forms—tall or short, male or female—to teach and transform. Holding talismans and records, they precisely assess merits and transgressions, good and evil karmic conditions, without the slightest error. Those who know this shall attain immortality and eternal life.

The Dao Lord said: There are also Eight Divine Lads.
The first is the Golden Flower Lad, whose divine name is Heavenly Origin. He governs the Son of Heaven, crown princes, consorts, and ancestral temples; the renewal of the old and establishment of the new; the enthronement of rulers and replacement of sovereigns; the offering of counsel and rejection of folly; tribute and taxation; wealth and treasures; chariots, horses, and attire; palaces, gardens, and hunting parks; ponds, terraces, and pavilions; ranks, emoluments, and summons; and all movements and travels.
The second is the Yellow Spirit Lad, whose divine name is Heavenly Maiden. He governs dwellings, tombs, and mausoleums; livestock and crops; granaries and storehouses; sons and daughters; longevity and premature death; illness and disease; and the construction of earthworks, mountains, rivers, and valleys.
The third is the Pure Spirit Lad, whose divine name is Heavenly Might. He governs roads, vehicles, and vessels; forests, trees, flowers, and fruits; and thunder, lightning, wind, and rain.
The fourth is the Bright Spirit Lad, whose divine name is Heavenly Life. He governs wells, stoves, doors, and gates; ditches, latrines, and cesspits; impurity, filth, and lewdness; and falsehood and deceit.
The fifth is the Cinnabar Spirit Lad, whose divine name is Heavenly Radiance. He governs prisons and confinement; documents and childbirth; bloodshed, fire, and disasters.
The sixth is the Mysterious Spirit Lad, whose divine name is Heavenly Communication. He governs life spans and their extension or curtailment; demons, specters, and goblins; curses, prayers, and sacrifices; and all spirits and ghosts.
The seventh is the Purple Spirit Lad, whose divine name is Heavenly Perfection. He governs wandering souls and lost spirits; roaming corpses and the dead; and those sunk in hell.
The eighth is the White Spirit Lad, whose divine name is Heavenly Prosperity. He governs fathers, mothers, sons, and daughters; husbands, wives, and childbirth.

These Eight Divine Lads sometimes ride wind, rain, clouds, and thunder, mounting dragons and tigers as they move in and out of the human realm, observing good and evil. If one is good, fortune follows; if evil, misfortune ensues. They respond according to karmic conditions, never erring. You, men and women, should but recite this sutra, and the Eight Divine Lads will come to protect you, bestowing blessings, dispelling calamities, eradicating sins and transgressions—effects beyond imagination.

The Dao Lord said: No one receives life without coming from past karma. Thus, each is endowed with a divine and exceptional nature, each with its own karmic conditions. Whether sinful or auspicious spirits, fortune or misfortune, all arise from one’s karma. Therefore, differences in longevity or premature death, nobility or lowliness, prosperity or adversity, beauty or ugliness, wealth or poverty, foolishness or wisdom—all vary. Even birds, beasts, insects, fish, chickens, dogs, grasses, and trees are likewise. You, men and women, should each reflect upon this.

The Dao Lord said: The receiving of a human body is a rare encounter. Once it decays, when will one meet such an opportunity again for ten thousand kalpas? Therefore, I constantly and earnestly exhort you to diligently cultivate purification rites, practice the Dao, recite scriptures, pay homage, burn incense, light lamps, make offerings, make vows, repent, save the living and deliver the dead, create images, copy scriptures, establish abbeys, and guide others—employing all manner of expedient means to establish future blessings for sentient beings. What could I possibly seek for myself?

The Dao Lord said: In ancient times, when King Miaofan died, he invited three hundred and sixty eminent Daoist masters to the palace. They repented, received the precepts, and offered his clothing, ornaments, bedding, curtains, gold, silver, chariots, horses, jeweled canopies, silks, brocades, utensils, and servants—all dedicated to the numinous abbey and the altar of the Daoist nuns and masters. Their sincerity moved the heavens, and the gods rejoiced greatly. I dispatched the True Person of Good Life, who rode a three-wheeled phoenix chariot with jade lads and maidens to welcome him into the Fire-Refining Pool, where his true form was refined. After three years, he was reborn in the royal palace. Fourteen years later, he reclaimed the throne, greatly cultivated the Dao, and widely established merit. He lived for seven hundred years. I then sent the True Person of Mysterious Communication, seated upon a lotus throne and a flying cloud chariot, to welcome him into the Palace of Square Cauldrons, where he studied scriptures and methods. He attained a lifespan of eight thousand years and now serves as the Attendant Lad of Azure Flower.

When the king of Tonghua died, he invited forty-six thousand Daoist masters to recite scriptures, practice the Dao, create images, copy scriptures, deliver people, establish abbeys, burn incense, scatter flowers, and perform the Five Refining Rites for the Living Spirit. Within a hundred days, I dispatched the True Person of Transformative Mandate, along with the Eight Wind Messengers and Thunderbolt Generals, who came at night to welcome him. Mounting a cloud-dragon chariot, he was conveyed to the Southern Prosperity Palace to further study scriptures and methods. After ten thousand years, he became the True Person of Fire Radiance, governing this Fire Pool.

In ancient times, when a worthy man was at the end of his life, his family invited Daoist masters and nuns to repent and receive the precepts. At the moment of his death, through the power of this sutra, he did not pass through hell but was immediately reborn into a family of virtue and goodness. There was also a woman who died, and her parents and family created images, copied scriptures, made banners and canopies, extensively lit lamps and candles, recited this sutra, established purification rites, practiced the Dao, meditated day and night without weariness, made offerings, released living beings, aided the poor, and delivered those in distress. After a hundred years, I commanded the Controller of Destiny to return her soul. She was restored to her home, where she greatly cultivated merit, supplied the Three Treasures, consulted Daoist masters, and received the true scriptures. She lived for three hundred years. I then dispatched the True Person of Transformative Mandate to deliver her. Her form was refined by wind and fire, and she was reborn as a man. Entering Golden Flower Mountain, she consumed elixirs and lived for over seventy thousand years, ascending to the Western Numinous Palace to become an unsurpassed Dharma Master.

chunks.original_text: 太上洞玄灵宝业报因缘经卷之八竟 太上洞玄灵宝业报因绿经卷之九 弘救品第二十 大慈大悲普济真人曰：天尊所说罪福因缘，善巧方便，开度众生，甚深微妙，不可思议。 然地狱穷魂，苦毒无量，楚痛难堪，虽蒙救拔，复虑沉沦，万劫辛酸，痛恼何极。 伏愿天尊慈悲广洽，更开要道，使早迁升，过去未来，俱沾利益，为诸男女历劫桥梁。 尔时太上道君曰：吾为汝等一切众生所说因源缘，示其罪福，欲令天下识宿命根，大设法门，引诸男女随其业力，使出幽牢生死阶梯，渐顿咸尽。 汝今复欲简要，速得迁升。 汝等男女，各宜谛听，凝静身心，受其妙道。 人之禀生，同资一气。 及乎诞育，系命三元，寿夭吉凶、富贵贫贱、因缘罪福、善恶死生，各逐宿根，悉有报对，随其业力，永不差移，如影逐形，似声应响。 三元者，谓上、中、下也。 一者上元，正月十五日，天官主录。 二者中元，七月十五日，地官主录。 三者下元，十月十五日，水官主录。 与三界十方、诸天上圣、妙行真人、玉童玉女、五帝四司、善恶童子，一切神灵无鞅数众，俱会玄都元阳宫中。 元始之前，考较男女生死录籍、罪福因缘。 及九幽地狱、水府穷魂，悉来校诚善恶令分。 此时若有善男子、善女人，能发自然道意，采诸华果、名衣上服、百宝珍奇、玩弄卧卧、诸香杂药、清浄饮食，及上妙罗绮、锦绣纹缯、众彩诸色，造玄都大献，种种装严，一层两层、乃至百层千层，作玄都玉京五岳名山、楼阁台榭、堂殿形像，妙丽精饰，或千或万，以用供养，散华烧香，行道讲诵，燃灯放生，歌咏赞叹，布施发愿，悔过求哀，礼拜灭罪，昼夜不懈，我遣十天真人并诸天帝、飞天神王、三界四司、玉童玉女无量数众，飞空步虚，持幢建节，把录执符，齐到道场，为其灭罪，保护人民，使国土安宁，男女欢泰，众善齐降，诸恶不生，地狱苦魂一时解脱，克生天上，快乐无为，率土太平，获福无量。 道君曰：吾昔从元始天尊，赤明元年七月十五日，於福集世界信行国土元寿观中，大会说法，十方天帝、神仙、真圣无鞅数众，及诸龙鬼一时来会，听无妙相义。 时东方国土仁爱天王造九层玄都宝盘九百枚，悉以青珠青玉、青金青宝、青纹青锦、青纱青谷、青罗青绮、青华青果、青香青网，乃至旛幢宝盖、衣服帐舆、饮食器物，皆同一色，飞云彩鹤、翔鸾绮凤、金翅朱鸟、天仙伎乐填满东方，来到会中，以用供养。 东南国土慈和天王造十二层玄都宝盘一百二十枚，悉以绀珠绀玉、绀金绀宝、绀纹绀锦、绀纱绀谷、绀罗绀绮、绀华绀果、绀香绀网，乃至旛幢宝盖、衣服帐舆、饮食器物，皆同一色，飞云彩鹤、翔鸾舞凤、金翅朱鸟、神龙伎乐，填满东南，来到会中，以用供养。 南方国土礼教天王造三层玄都宝盘三百枚，悉以丹珠丹玉、丹金丹宝、丹纹丹锦、丹纱谷、丹罗丹绮、丹华丹果、丹香丹网，乃至旛幢宝盖、衣服帐舆、饮食器物，皆同一色，飞云彩鹤、翔鸾舞凤、金翅朱鸟、神仙技乐，填满南方，来到会中，以用供养。 西南国土威范天王造十二层玄都宝盘一百二十枚，悉以红珠红玉、红金红宝、红纹红锦、红纱红谷、红罗红绮、红华红果、红香红网，乃至旛幢宝盖、衣服帐舆、饮食器物，皆同一色，飞云彩鹤、翔鸾舞凤、金翅朱鸟、飞仙伎乐，填满西南，来到会中，以用供养。

**The Wondrous Treasure Sutra of Karmic Retribution and Causality, Scroll Eight (Conclusion)**

**The Wondrous Treasure Sutra of Karmic Retribution and Causality, Scroll Nine**
**Chapter Twenty: The Vast Salvation**

The All-Compassionate, Universally Saving Perfected One said: The karmic conditions of sin and blessing expounded by the Heavenly Worthy are profoundly subtle and wondrous, beyond conception, employing skillful means to deliver sentient beings. Yet the suffering souls in hell endure boundless agony, their torment unbearable. Though they may receive deliverance, we still fear their relapse into the abyss, enduring ten thousand kalpas of bitterness—how endless their anguish! We humbly beseech the Heavenly Worthy to extend boundless compassion, revealing the essential Dao, that they may swiftly ascend, and both past and future beings alike receive benefit, serving as a bridge across kalpas for all men and women.

Then the Most High Lord of the Dao said: I have expounded the origins of causality for all sentient beings, revealing the consequences of sin and blessing, that the world may recognize the roots of past lives. I have established vast Dharma gates, guiding men and women according to their karmic power, enabling them to escape the dark prison of the cycle of birth and death, whether gradually or suddenly, until all is exhausted. Now you further seek brevity, desiring swift ascent. Men and women, listen carefully, compose your bodies and minds, and receive this wondrous Dao.

All people are endowed with life from the same qi. At birth, their fate is bound to the Three Origins, determining longevity or premature death, fortune or misfortune, wealth or poverty, the conditions of sin and blessing, good and evil, life and death. Each follows the roots of past lives, all bearing karmic retribution, unerringly determined by their deeds, like a shadow following form, or an echo responding to sound.

The Three Origins are the Upper, Middle, and Lower Origins. The Upper Origin falls on the fifteenth day of the first month, presided over by the Heavenly Official. The Middle Origin falls on the fifteenth day of the seventh month, presided over by the Earthly Official. The Lower Origin falls on the fifteenth day of the tenth month, presided over by the Water Official. Together with the Three Realms, the ten directions, all the sagely beings of the heavens, Perfected Ones of wondrous conduct, Jade Lads and Jade Maidens, the Five Emperors and Four Controllers, the divine youths of good and evil, and all the innumerable spirits of the divine multitude, they assemble in the Mysterious Capital of the Primordial Yang Palace. Before the Origin of the Primordial Beginning, they examine the records of life and death, the karmic conditions of sin and blessing for all men and women. Even the suffering souls of the Nine Dark Hells and the Watery Abyss are summoned to verify the division of good and evil.

At this time, if there are good men and good women who awaken the natural intention of the Dao, gather all manner of flowers and fruits, fine garments and robes, rare treasures and precious objects, toys and playthings, various incenses and medicines, pure food and drink, as well as the finest silks, brocades, and multicolored fabrics, to create the Great Offering of the Mysterious Capital—adorned in myriad ways, layer upon layer, from one or two to a hundred or a thousand—constructing the Jade Capital of the Mysterious Capital, the Five Sacred Peaks, famous mountains, pavilions and terraces, halls and palaces, and sacred images, exquisitely decorated and refined, numbering in the thousands or tens of thousands, to be used in offerings; scattering flowers, burning incense, practicing the Dao, reciting scriptures, lighting lamps, releasing living beings, singing hymns of praise, making vows, repenting transgressions, seeking mercy, prostrating to eliminate sins, day and night without ceasing—I shall dispatch the Ten Heavenly Perfected Ones, along with all the Heavenly Emperors, Flying Heavenly Devas, Divine Kings of the Three Realms and Four Controllers, Jade Lads and Jade Maidens in countless numbers. They will traverse the void, bearing banners and standards, holding registers and talismans, arriving together at the ritual site to eliminate sins, protect the people, ensure the peace of the land, bring joy to men and women, bestow all blessings, prevent all evils, liberate the suffering souls of hell in an instant, enabling them to be reborn in heaven, enjoying boundless bliss, bringing universal peace and immeasurable fortune.

The Lord of the Dao said: In the past, during the first year of the Red Clarity era of the Primordial Heavenly Worthy, on the fifteenth day of the seventh month, in the Longevity Abbey of the Land of Faith and Practice in the World of Blessed Assembly, I convened a great Dharma assembly. The Heavenly Emperors of the ten directions, divine immortals, Perfected Ones, and sages in countless numbers, along with all dragons and spirits, gathered to hear the teachings of the Wondrous Marks.

At that time, the Benevolent and Loving Heavenly King of the Eastern Land crafted nine hundred nine-tiered Mysterious Capital Offering Trays, all adorned with azure pearls, azure jade, azure gold, azure treasures, azure brocades, azure gauze, azure silk, azure fruits, azure incense, azure nets, and even banners, standards, jeweled canopies, garments, curtains, carriages, food vessels, and utensils—all of a single azure hue. Flying clouds, colorful cranes, soaring simurghs, dancing phoenixes, golden-winged vermilion birds, and celestial musicians filled the eastern sky, arriving at the assembly to make offerings.

The Compassionate and Harmonious Heavenly King of the Southeastern Land crafted one hundred twenty twelve-tiered Mysterious Capital Offering Trays, all adorned with violet pearls, violet jade, violet gold, violet treasures, violet brocades, violet gauze, violet silk, violet fruits, violet incense, violet nets, and even banners, standards, jeweled canopies, garments, curtains, carriages, food vessels, and utensils—all of a single violet hue. Flying clouds, colorful cranes, soaring simurghs, dancing phoenixes, golden-winged vermilion birds, and divine dragon musicians filled the southeastern sky, arriving at the assembly to make offerings.

The Ritual and Teachings Heavenly King of the Southern Land crafted three hundred three-tiered Mysterious Capital Offering Trays, all adorned with cinnabar pearls, cinnabar jade, cinnabar gold, cinnabar treasures, cinnabar brocades, cinnabar gauze, cinnabar silk, cinnabar fruits, cinnabar incense, cinnabar nets, and even banners, standards, jeweled canopies, garments, curtains, carriages, food vessels, and utensils—all of a single cinnabar hue. Flying clouds, colorful cranes, soaring simurghs, dancing phoenixes, golden-winged vermilion birds, and divine immortal musicians filled the southern sky, arriving at the assembly to make offerings.

The Majestic and Disciplined Heavenly King of the Southwestern Land crafted one hundred twenty twelve-tiered Mysterious Capital Offering Trays, all adorned with crimson pearls, crimson jade, crimson gold, crimson treasures, crimson brocades, crimson gauze, crimson silk, crimson fruits, crimson incense, crimson nets, and even banners, standards, jeweled canopies, garments, curtains, carriages, food vessels, and utensils—all of a single crimson hue. Flying clouds, colorful cranes, soaring simurghs, dancing phoenixes, golden-winged vermilion birds, and flying immortal musicians filled the southwestern sky, arriving at the assembly to make offerings.

The immeasurable Heavenly Kings of the Upper Lands each crafted thirty-six thousand thirty-six-tiered Mysterious Capital Offering Trays, all adorned with purple pearls, purple jade, purple gold, purple treasures, purple brocades, purple gauze, purple silk, purple fruits, purple incense, purple nets, and even banners, standards, jeweled canopies, garments, curtains, carriages, food vessels, and utensils—all of a single purple hue. chunks.original_text: 三界十方同沾福庆，喜乐难言，九幽罢对，五苦停酸，国土安宁，人民快乐。 道君曰：昔弃善国王不修正化，杀害无度，田猎遨游，不恤贫穷，枉伤良善，广造宫殿，纵放百端。 十三年中，人民怨叛，王身被戮，魂入三涂，众苦备经。 五十八年，昼夜酸禁。 其子承统，知父为非，救己自修，大行慈俭，人民庆乐，率土安宁，礼拜烧香，常行斋直。 每於元日，广建福田，行道讲经，燃灯发愿，抄经造像，置观度人，布施放生，采诸华果、名香上药、玩弄服饰、绞罗锦绮、众宝珍奇、种种法具，清浄饮食、米麦杂彩，造玄都宝盘，供养天尊及诸真圣贤人、道士出家法身无量数众。 九年之中，功德熏修，得离地狱，上生天堂。 圣善国王及以皇后、诸王妃主、宰辅大臣、国中男女、贤人道士，常於三元造七宝盘，以上妙香药、清浄饮食、诸杂缯彩，众宝装严，百层、千层、无边无量，送诸灵观玄坛、名山圣迩，随处安置，供养十方三界、过去未来见在三世诸天尊等仙真上圣，普皆回向，散华烧香，礼拜诵念，持斋奉戒，讲说大乘，布施放生，常行不替。 十八年中，男女端等，皆同一貌，无有夭伤，天人欢乐，衣食自然。 正化国王及以皇后，常於三元躬自烧香散华，行道讲诵，礼拜发愿，谢罪祈恩，尽国中所有金银珍宝，造九重宝盘玄都大献三百六十，香华宝盖、帐舆幢并诸音乐，周匝围绕； 於其正殿及以庭阙，广建道场，命召道士立百宝座，讲说大乘，昼夜丹祷，供养天尊。 国土太平，兆民欢乐，幽魂拔度，悉上福堂，男女欣欣，年命长远。 平乐国王与诸大臣、皇后妃主及国中男女，常以三元月旦，於其宫内建百高座，召诸道士及以女冠讲说三洞大乘经典，行道礼忏，布施放生，抄经铸像，置观度人，造三十六重玄都宝盘千二百所，种种装严，以用供养。 至其元日，大建福田，保国泰民宁，和天安地，风调雨顺，百谷熟成，七祖生天，九幽罢对，男女昌炽，天下太平。 昔有贤者，为过去九玄、七祖及父母、己身、内外眷属、一切众生，常於三元之日造玄都大献，罄其诚恳，资财物产、香油灯烛、饮食华果，随分所有供养天尊及诸道士。 八年之中，九祖生天，见世安乐，年命长远，衣食自然。 复有女人，常造玄都大献，普为一切。 二十年中，身有光明，三界侍门。 复有道士，为国主人王、人民万物、过去见存、天下地上一切众生，造玄都大献，供养诸天及以道士、三涂地狱饿鬼穷魂。 十四年中，白日升天。 复有道士，常劝男女为亿曾万祖、人民品物、国主人王，采诸华果、百味饮食、名衣上服、珍奇宝货、玩弄卧具、旛华幢盖，作玄都大献七宝山盘，於其元日供养天尊及诸圣众，礼拜忏悔，散华烧香。 三十二年，得为四梵真人。 道君曰：清明国无相山中，有道士三万六千人，常以立夏一日入静安居，烧香行道，礼忏讲诵，持斋奉戒，劝诱男女，开度天人，作诸善业，昼夜不住； 愿国安宁，救度生死，广设桥梁。 王及皇后并诸妃主、宰辅大臣、国中男女，各发道心，随分供养，饮食滋味、香药器具、上妙衣服、车舆象马、绫罗锦绮、金银珠玉、米麦华果、卧具帱帐、田园童仆种种，布施供养，资给安居道士，虔心敬仰，愿得功德，利益装严。
chunks.translated_text:
The blessings and joys of the Three Realms and the ten directions were universally shared, their happiness beyond words. The Nine Dark Realms ceased their judgments, the Five Sufferings halted their bitterness, the lands knew peace, and the people rejoiced.

The Dao Lord said: "In former times, the King of Abandoned Virtue did not cultivate proper governance. He slaughtered without restraint, hunted for sport, and neglected the poor. He wantonly harmed the good and innocent, and built palaces in extravagance, indulging in a hundred excesses. Within thirteen years, the people rose in rebellion, and the king himself was executed. His soul fell into the Three Wretched Realms, enduring every suffering for fifty-eight years, day and night in bitter torment.

His son inherited the throne and, recognizing his father’s wrongs, saved himself through self-cultivation. He practiced great compassion and frugality, bringing joy to the people and peace to the land. He bowed in worship, burned incense, and constantly observed fasts and integrity. On the first day of each year, he widely established fields of merit: walking the Dao, expounding sutras, lighting lamps, and making vows. He transcribed scriptures, commissioned images, founded temples to liberate beings, practiced almsgiving, and released living creatures. He gathered all manner of flowers, fruits, rare incense, superior medicines, playthings, garments, silks, brocades, and countless treasures—various ritual implements, pure foods, grains, and multicolored fabrics—to craft the Mystic Capital’s jeweled platters. These he offered to the Heavenly Worthy, all the perfected sages, worthies, and the immeasurable assembly of Daoist renunciates. Over nine years, his accumulated merit and cultivation enabled him to escape hell and ascend to heaven.

The Sage and Good King, along with his queen, the various princes, consorts, ministers, and all the men and women of the realm—worthy persons and Daoist practitioners—regularly on the Three Primordials crafted seven-jeweled platters. With finest incense, medicines, pure foods, and multicolored silks, adorned with countless treasures, they fashioned hundreds, thousands, boundless and immeasurable layers. These they sent to the numinous temples and sacred peaks, placing them everywhere to make offerings to the Heavenly Worthies of the Three Realms and the ten directions, past, future, and present, and to all the perfected immortals and supreme sages. Universally they dedicated the merit, scattering flowers, burning incense, bowing in worship, reciting scriptures, observing fasts, upholding precepts, expounding the Great Vehicle, practicing almsgiving, and releasing living beings—constantly and without cease. Over eighteen years, men and women alike became of one countenance, free from premature death. Heavenly beings and humans rejoiced, and clothing and food arose spontaneously.

The King of Proper Governance and his queen, on the Three Primordials, personally burned incense, scattered flowers, walked the Dao, expounded scriptures, bowed in worship, and made vows, repenting of transgressions and praying for blessings. They used all the gold, silver, and treasures of the realm to craft nine-tiered jeweled platters for the Great Offering of the Mystic Capital—three hundred and sixty in number—adorned with fragrant flowers, jeweled canopies, banners, and all manner of music, encircling them completely. Within the main palace hall and its courtyards, they established vast ritual precincts, summoning Daoist practitioners to sit upon hundred-jeweled thrones and expound the Great Vehicle. Day and night they offered sincere prayers, making offerings to the Heavenly Worthy. The land knew great peace, the people rejoiced, and the souls of the departed were delivered, all ascending to the halls of blessing. Men and women were filled with joy, their lifespans long and distant.

The King of Peace and Joy, together with his great ministers, queen, consorts, and all the men and women of the realm, regularly on the first day of the Three Primordial months established hundred-high thrones within the palace. They summoned Daoist practitioners and female renunciates to expound the Three Caverns’ Great Vehicle scriptures, walk the Dao, and perform repentance rituals. They practiced almsgiving, released living creatures, transcribed scriptures, cast images, founded temples to liberate beings, and crafted thirty-six-tiered platters of the Mystic Capital’s treasure—one thousand two hundred in number—adorned in various ways for offerings. On the first day of each year, they widely established fields of merit to protect the nation, bring peace to the people, harmonize heaven and earth, ensure timely winds and rains, and bring the hundred grains to ripeness. Their seven ancestors ascended to heaven, the judgments of the Nine Dark Realms ceased, men and women flourished, and the land knew great peace.

In former times, a worthy person, for the sake of the nine generations of ancestors, the seven generations of forebears, his parents, himself, his inner and outer kin, and all beings, regularly on the Three Primordials crafted the Great Offering of the Mystic Capital. With utmost sincerity, he dedicated his wealth, property, incense, oil, lamps, candles, foods, and fruits—whatever he possessed—to make offerings to the Heavenly Worthy and all Daoist practitioners. Over eight years, his nine ancestors ascended to heaven, his present life knew happiness, his lifespan lengthened, and clothing and food arose spontaneously.

Another woman constantly crafted the Great Offering of the Mystic Capital, universally dedicating it for all. Over twenty years, her body emitted light, and the gates of the Three Realms served her.

Another Daoist, for the sake of the king, the people, all beings, past and present, and all creatures above and below the earth, crafted the Great Offering of the Mystic Capital, making offerings to all the heavens, Daoist practitioners, and the hungry ghosts and destitute souls of the Three Wretched Realms. Over fourteen years, he ascended to heaven in broad daylight.

Yet another Daoist constantly exhorted men and women to act on behalf of their countless ancestors, the people, all beings, and the king. They gathered flowers, fruits, a hundred flavors of food and drink, fine garments, rare treasures, playthings, bedding, banners, flowers, canopies, and crafted seven-jeweled mountain-platters for the Great Offering of the Mystic Capital. On the first day of each year, they made offerings to the Heavenly Worthy and all the sages, bowing in repentance, scattering flowers, and burning incense. Over thirty-two years, he became a Perfected One of the Four Brahmā Heavens.

The Dao Lord said: "In the Formless Mountain of the Luminous Land, there were thirty-six thousand Daoist practitioners. Regularly on the first day of summer, they entered seclusion, burned incense, walked the Dao, performed repentance rituals, expounded scriptures, observed fasts, upheld precepts, exhorted men and women, liberated heavenly beings and humans, and performed all manner of good deeds day and night without cease. They prayed for the nation’s peace, delivered beings from the cycle of birth and death, and widely established bridges.

The king, queen, consorts, ministers, and all the men and women of the realm each aroused the mind of the Dao. According to their means, they made offerings of foods and delicacies, incense, medicines, utensils, finest garments, carriages, elephants, horses, silks, brocades, gold, silver, pearls, jade, grains, fruits, bedding, curtains, fields, gardens, servants, and all manner of things to support and supply the secluded Daoist practitioners. With sincere reverence, they prayed to gain merit, adornment, and benefit."
